mount_name = '/mnt/nicoleblbstg'

if not any(mount.mountPoint == mount_name for mount in dbutils.fs.mounts()):              
    dbutils.fs.mount(
        source = "wasbs://nicoleblbstg@nicoleblbstg.blob.core.windows.net",
        mount_point = mount_name,
        extra_configs = {"fs.azure.account.key.nicoleblbstg.blob.core.windows.net":"IekjFA+sqW3MwykZV7B4S5/7dzbB600psa9QyWnfYZDMBCylvKQvXcdnR17S1Vo3wvpuUMsDOv1Dh009DMEjQw=="})

# Import PySpark
import pyspark
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, IntegerType
import sas7bdat

#read and write required Metadata columns
    df = spark.read.format("com.github.saurfang.sas.spark").load("/mnt/nicoleblbstg/sample_dataset_contents.sas7bdat", 
                                                                 forceLowercaseNames=True, inferLong=True)
    df.write.mode('overwrite').parquet('/dbfs/mnt/nicoleblbstg/sas-to-parquet-using-spark/sample_dataset_contents')
    display(df)

def sas_to_parquet(filelist, source, destination):
    rows = 0
    for i, filename in enumerate(filelist):
     #Read sas7bdat into Spark Data frame
     spark_df = spark.read.format("com.github.saurfang.sas.spark").load(source+filename+'.sas7bdat', 
                                                                        forceLowercaseNames=True, inferLong=True)
     #Write to Parquet File
     spark_df.write.mode('overwrite').parquet(destination+filename)
###################### not needed for display purposes ######################
     data = spark.read.parquet(destination+filename)
     display(data)
     print("Schema: {}".format(data.schema))
###################### not needed for display purposes ######################
sas_to_parquet(['sample_file_1','sample_file_3','sample_file_4','sample_file_2'], 
               '/mnt/nicoleblbstg/', '/mnt/nicoleblbstg/sas-to-parquet-using-spark/')
